Specific Details: Brexit: the challenge for Irish business.
DPOs Lobbied: Pip Breen|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Terry Shannon|Councillor|Cork City Council::Pat McMahon|Councillor|Clare County Council::Joe Carroll|Councillor|Cork County Council::Frank O'Flynn|Councillor|Cork County Council::Bill Slattery|Councillor|Clare County Council::Oliver Walsh|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Larry O'Brien|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Dianne Nolan|Councillor|Kerry County Council::Michael Lowry|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Deirdre O'Brien|Councillor|Cork County Council::Michael O'Shea|Councillor|Kerry County Council
Subject Matter: Brexit: the challenge for Irish business.
Intended Results: To ensure that policy-makers, political parties and local government  are fully aware of the economic risks associated with Brexit and the likely impact that different scenarios have for individual companies.::To ensure the Government, State agencies and local government take proactive steps domestically to offset these risks.::To ensure Government adopts a position in negotiations that seeks to minimise economic disruption and adverse effects on Irish companies.

Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Pat Ivory, Ibec EU and International Affairs

Specific Details: calling for the Minister for Finance to include cider producers, that manufacture less than 15,000 hectolitres per annum of cider to avail of an excise relief programme for Budget 2022.  The excise relief must offer a 50% reduction in excise for those small-scale producers.
Subject Matter: calling for the Minister for Finance to include cider producers, that manufacture less than 15,000 hectolitres per annum of cider to avail of an excise relief programme for Budget 2022.  The excise relief must offer a 50% reduction in excise for those small-scale producers.
Intended Results: A 50% duty rate on the first 15,000 hectolitres would put small-scale cider producers on a similar footing (in terms of duty payable) to microbrewers. The establishment of a reduced excise duty band would encourage new entrants into cider making and would support established small-scale cideries in their development.
Lobbying Activities: |Email|2-5
